Question
========
  
A greengrocer advertises bags of oranges averaging 10 pounds. To check whether he can make his claim TRUE, the greengrocer weighs 25 randomly selected bags. The average weight of these bags is 9.6 kilograms with a standard deviation of 1. Which of the following statements is then correct if with $\alpha$  = 5% the null hypotheses H0:$\mu \geq$ 10 and H0:$$mu$ = 10 are tested separately?

I.   The null hypothesis H0:$\mu \geq$ 10 10 is rejected. II.  The null hypothesis H0:$\mu$ = 10 is rejected.

  
Answerlist
----------
* Pronunciation I is correct, pronunciation II is incorrect.
* Utterance I is incorrect, utterance II is correct.
* Both utterances are correct.
* Both statements are incorrect.
